And I've seen many! Five ceramides, five types of protein and three of Rosemary (its oil, water and extract).   No.2 Rosemary's helped with my hair loss issues in the past. I've seen results with products that are 'left-on' and contain Rosemary Oil. But applying them takes time and I thought the shampoo would be a quick and easy substitute.  Unfortunately though, even the best of ingredients sometimes don't have the right delivery system - in this case the base product. The shampoo is surprisingly strong for something SLS-free. Whilst it hasn't stripped my hair color (yet), it makes my hair feel dried out and I end up using a ton of conditioner afterwards to restore it. For this reason I can only use it once or twice a week. Love the fragrance, which reminds me of a spa, and the shampoo is definitely not overly priced, based on those ingredients, BUT if I can't use it as often as I want to, or ought to - to see results, then what's the point? Besides, I don't think Rosemary being immediately washed off is going to have the same effect as Rosemary left to soak in to your scalp/follicles. I'll go back to the product that was working for me previously.   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1.
